title: Mineral Salt Medium \(MSM) for extreme acidophilic microorganisms
procedures:
For 1x Medium:
3.0 g/l \(NH<sub>4</sub>)<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub>
3.2 g/l Na<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> x10H<sub>2</sub>O
0.1 g/l KCl
0.05 g/l K<sub>2</sub>HPO<sub>4</sub>
0.5 g/l MgSO<sub>4</sub> x7H<sub>2</sub>O
0.01 g/l Ca\(NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>
For 10x Stock:
30 g/l \(NH<sub>4</sub>)<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub>
32 g/l Na<sub>2</sub>SO<sub>4</sub> x10H<sub>2</sub>O
1 g/l KCl
0.5 g/l K<sub>2</sub>HPO<sub>4</sub>
5 g/l MgSO<sub>4</sub> x7H<sub>2</sub>O
0.1 g/l Ca\(NO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>2</sub>
- Add the constituents into a final volume of 1 liter of water, one at a time, dissolving before adding the next.
- Adjust the pH to 2.0 with sulfuric acid \(and/or sodium hydroxide)
-Autoclave
